title: Teapot And Cover, "Hexagonal Landform Teapot # 2", 1985
markings: Incised signature on underside of base: "Notkin/1985" in script.
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisition Endowment
description: Teapot fabricated entirely of unglazed dark brown stoneware, as in manner of I-Hsing wares. Flat-based octagonal body (a); upright sides modelled to resemble cross-section through concrete street and sidewalk, with indented brickwork niche at one side. Upper surface of body flat, modelled as section of street, with curb, sidewalk, and partial sewer cap. handle formed as square sewer pipe, joined at top with simulated automobile tires, with another tire hanging loose on handle. Spout formed as angled sewer pipe. Inset cover (b) with three stacked tires.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Teapot And Cover, "Hexagonal Landform Teapot # 2", 1985.
1985. Stoneware. Museum purchase from General Acquisition Endowment. 1985-59-1-a,b.
